channel.title: Up Arrow For LIFT, Down Arrow For UNLIFT
channel.description:
Something I've lamented is that we don't have an UNLIFT glyph on the keyboard. I want down arrow.
foo: func [...] [... return unlift value] bar: func [...] [... return ↓ value]
Given that we do support UTF-8, maybe going ahead and investing in a key binding for up arrow as synonym for LIFT and the down arrow as a synonym for UNLIFT is worth it...
---
> **UPDATE 2025:** The behavior of **(^foo: ...)** to write lifted values, and **(^foo)** to fetch unlifted values, has allowed caret to serve both roles--working within the "meta-represented" realm. This means the lone UNLIFT and LIFT operations are used much more rarely. > > But... this doesn't mean that in things like Rebmu, defining the up and down arrows for LIFT and UNLIFT respectively would be a bad idea...

item.title: Up Arrow For LIFT, Down Arrow For UNLIFT
item.dc:creator: hostilefork
item.description:
Something I've lamented is that we don't have an UNLIFT glyph on the keyboard. I want down arrow.

foo: func [...] [... return unlift value]
bar: func [...] [... return ↓ value]

Given that we do support UTF-8, maybe going ahead and investing in a key binding for up arrow as synonym for LIFT and the down arrow as a synonym for UNLIFT is worth it...

UPDATE 2025: The behavior of (^foo: ...) to write lifted values, and (^foo) to fetch unlifted values, has allowed caret to serve both roles--working within the "meta-represented" realm. This means the lone UNLIFT and LIFT operations are used much more rarely.

But... this doesn't mean that in things like Rebmu, defining the up and down arrows for LIFT and UNLIFT respectively would be a bad idea...
